intro: Hieracium jurassicum subsp. lancifrons, commonly known as the Jurassic hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The subspecies lancifrons is distinguished by its sharply pointed, lance-shaped leaves and yellowish flowers. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in some areas.
